faq.question: What should be the team composition?
faq.Answer: A team consists of 3 to 5 students of same age category from same school are eligible to participate in the Hackathons

faq.question: When and Where It’ll be?
faq.Answer: Competition will take place online. The competition will start on 27th Feb 2022 and end on 06th March 2022

faq.question: How can We submit our project?
faq.Answer: You can submit your project through the google form/Devpost link

faq.question: How can I contact the organizers?
faq.Answer: You can join the Whatsapp group or the Discord Server. If you need further assistance you can contact one of our organizers through a link.

faq.question: Can I build anything I want?
faq.Answer: No, you must build a project which falls under the themes respect to your age category mentioned in the themes section

rules: All the team members should be from the same age group and same school/institute.
There can be a maximum of 3 members and a minimum of 2 members in a team.
There can be more than 1 team per age category from 1 school.
When registering the team leader must fill out the information of all remaining team members.
Registrations will be closed on 25th February 2022 at 12AM.
You have to follow 1 chosen theme for your project from the ones mentioned beforehand.
One team is only allowed to submit one project.

The project MUST be deployed to a private GitHub repository and all the collaborations must be done through GitHub. We will be monitoring every contribution/commit to the codebase when reviewing your project. Every team member’s contribution is required.
The Git repository for the project must be created before 24 hours has passed after submitting the registration form.
You should make a video that is no longer than 5 minutes about your project. If you are not sure what to include in the video,
You should submit your project before 12AM on 3rd of March 2022.
You are not allowed to make changes to the code after submitting.
